text:
Exception: cannot resolve symbol symbol : variable apache location: class java.lang.String org.apache.jasper.runtime.JspRuntimeLibrary.include(request, response, "mytable.jsp", out, false); --description------------------------------------- caused from the variabile "org" in correspondence of <%@include file="myinclude.jsp"%> note without the the error not occured tested on Linux and Windows2k - tomcat version 5.18 and 5.25 ------------------------------------------------- this is an example... /----------------file index.jsp----------------- <%@page contentType="text/html;charset=UTF-8"%> <%@include file="myinclude.jsp"%> try

Hi all

//-------------end-file index.jsp---------------- //----------------file myinclude.jsp------------- <% //this page make a little test of user instance ... String org = new String("prova"); // the problem look like this name instance "org" %> //------------end-file myinclude.jsp------------- //----------------file mytable.jsp-------------
   
//----------------file mytable.jsp-------------
creator: ivan+apache@ceradini.it
remm@apache.org
text:
I find it rather amazing that you would be filing a bug about this "issue". It
should be obvious what is going on by looking about the generated code (and even
without looking ...) with a variable named "org" (and no, we can't fix the
problem by adding an import), given that our package structure starts with
"org.apache".
